title.narrative: Addis Ababa Bottle And Glass Share Company

description.narrative: The Project will help Addis Ababa Bottle & Glass Share Company (Addis Glass) triple its container glass manufacturing capacity from 80 tons per day today to 240 tons per day by 2022 in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. IFC would be investing alongside an East African based PE firm specializing in growth, buyout, recapitalization, acquisition, replacement capital, and pre-IPO investments in medium-sized companies who is contemplating an equity investment in the Business.

The most significant, expected project-level outcome is driven largely by contributions to stakeholder effects (including Customers, by reducing prices and improving access to good quality glass bottles), and environmental effects (improving resource efficiency & recycling and increasing energy efficiency). Beyond the glass sector, the Project (including the effects brought about by other IFC projects in the value chain) has the potential to improve the competitiveness of other downstream industries in Ethiopia (such as the beverage industry) which depend on the availability of low container glass products for bottling finished products for end consumers. These projects collectively, are expected to lower market prices significantly and improve access to good quality container glass in an East Africa market that is highly underdeveloped.
